# Progress Indicators Guide

Our design system provides a comprehensive suite of components for indicating progress, each designed for a specific use case.

---

## Overview

| Component | Use Case | States |
|-----------|----------|--------|
| **Progress** | Linear progress bars | Determinate, Indeterminate |
| **CircularProgress** | Circular spinners/progress | Determinate, Indeterminate |
| **Stepper** | Multi-step processes | Completed, Active, Future, Error, Warning |
| **Skeleton** | Content placeholders | Pulse, Shimmer |

---

## 1. Progress (Linear Bar)

Use the `Progress` component for classic horizontal progress bars.

### Import

```tsx
import { Progress } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

### Determinate Progress

When you know the completion percentage:

```tsx
<Progress value={75} />

// With color
<Progress value={50} color="success" />

// With stripes
<Progress value={60} isStriped />

// With animated stripes
<Progress value={60} isStriped isAnimated />
```

### Indeterminate Progress

When you don't know the duration (e.g., waiting for a process to start). Just omit the `value` prop:

```tsx
<Progress />

// With color
<Progress color="info" />
```

### Composed with Labels

```tsx
<div>
  <div className="flex justify-between mb-1">
    <span className="text-sm font-medium">Uploading...</span>
    <span className="text-sm text-gray-500">75%</span>
  </div>
  <Progress value={75} />
</div>
```

### Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `value` | `number` | - | Progress value (0-100). Omit for indeterminate |
| `min` | `number` | `0` | Minimum value |
| `max` | `number` | `100` | Maximum value |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | `'md'` | Bar height |
| `color` | `'primary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info'` | `'primary'` | Color theme |
| `isStriped` | `boolean` | `false` | Show striped pattern |
| `isAnimated` | `boolean` | `false` | Animate stripes |

---

## 2. CircularProgress (Circular Spinner)

Use `CircularProgress` for compact loading indicators, often inside buttons or on top of images.

### Import

```tsx
import { CircularProgress } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

### Determinate Circular Progress

```tsx
<CircularProgress value={60} />

// With percentage display
<CircularProgress value={75} showPercentage />

// With custom content
<CircularProgress value={80}>
  <span className="text-xs">80</span>
</CircularProgress>
```

### Indeterminate (Spinner)

Just omit the `value` prop:

```tsx
<CircularProgress />

// Different sizes
<CircularProgress size="sm" />
<CircularProgress size="lg" />
```

### Inside Buttons

```tsx
<Button disabled>
  <CircularProgress size="sm" className="mr-2" />
  Processing...
</Button>
```

### Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `value` | `number` | - | Progress value (0-100). Omit for spinner |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | `'md'` | Size of the circle |
| `color` | `'primary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info'` | `'primary'` | Color theme |
| `thickness` | `number` | - | Stroke thickness (px) |
| `showPercentage` | `boolean` | `false` | Show percentage in center |
| `children` | `ReactNode` | - | Custom center content |

---

## 3. Stepper (Step-by-Step)

Use the `Stepper` compound component to guide users through a multi-stage process.

### Import

```tsx
import { Stepper } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

### Basic Vertical Stepper

```tsx
<Stepper currentStep={2}>
  <Stepper.Step title="Shipping" description="Enter your address" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Billing" description="Enter payment details" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Confirm" description="Review your order" />
</Stepper>
```

### Horizontal Stepper

```tsx
<Stepper currentStep={2} orientation="horizontal">
  <Stepper.Step title="Step 1" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Step 2" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Step 3" />
</Stepper>
```

### With Icons

```tsx
<Stepper currentStep={1}>
  <Stepper.Step title="Account" icon="person" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Address" icon="home" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Payment" icon="credit_card" />
</Stepper>
```

### With Error State

```tsx
<Stepper currentStep={2}>
  <Stepper.Step title="Details" status="completed" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Verification" status="error" description="Please fix errors" />
  <Stepper.Step title="Complete" />
</Stepper>
```

### Props (Stepper)

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `currentStep` | `number` | Required | Current active step (1-based) |
| `orientation` | `'horizontal' \| 'vertical'` | `'vertical'` | Layout direction |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | `'md'` | Size of steps |

### Props (Stepper.Step)

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `title` | `string` | Required | Step title |
| `description` | `string` | - | Step description |
| `icon` | `string` | - | Material icon name |
| `status` | `'completed' \| 'active' \| 'future' \| 'error' \| 'warning'` | Auto | Override status |
| `isRequired` | `boolean` | `false` | Show required indicator |
| `isClickable` | `boolean` | `false` | Make step clickable |
| `onClick` | `function` | - | Click handler |

---

## 4. Skeleton (Content Placeholder)

Use the `Skeleton` component to create placeholder previews of content that is still loading.

### Import

```tsx
import { Skeleton, SkeletonCircle, SkeletonText, SkeletonCard } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

### Basic Skeleton

Use `className` to control size and shape:

```tsx
// Rectangle
<Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" />

// Square
<Skeleton className="h-20 w-20" />

// Circle (for avatars)
<Skeleton className="h-12 w-12 rounded-full" />
```

### Multiple Lines

```tsx
<Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" count={3} />
```

### Animation Variants

```tsx
// Pulse (default)
<Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" variant="pulse" />

// Shimmer
<Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" variant="shimmer" />

// No animation
<Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" variant="none" />
```

### Helper Components

```tsx
// Avatar placeholder
<SkeletonCircle size={48} />

// Text lines
<SkeletonText lines={3} />

// Full card placeholder
<SkeletonCard />
```

### Card Loading Example

```tsx
<div className="p-4 border rounded-lg space-y-4">
  <div className="flex items-center space-x-4">
    <Skeleton className="h-12 w-12 rounded-full" />
    <div className="space-y-2 flex-1">
      <Skeleton className="h-4 w-1/2" />
      <Skeleton className="h-3 w-1/4" />
    </div>
  </div>
  <Skeleton className="h-40 w-full rounded-lg" />
  <Skeleton className="h-4 w-full" />
  <Skeleton className="h-4 w-3/4" />
</div>
```

### Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `className` | `string` | - | Control size, shape, layout |
| `count` | `number` | `1` | Number of skeleton items |
| `variant` | `'pulse' \| 'shimmer' \| 'none'` | `'pulse'` | Animation type |
| `isAnimated` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable/disable animation |

---

## Best Practices

### When to Use Each Component

| Scenario | Component |
|----------|-----------|
| File upload progress | `Progress` (determinate) |
| API call loading | `Progress` (indeterminate) or `CircularProgress` |
| Button loading state | `CircularProgress` (small) |
| Multi-step form | `Stepper` |
| Page loading | `Skeleton` |
| Card loading | `Skeleton` or `SkeletonCard` |
| Image loading | `Skeleton` with `className="aspect-video"` |

### Accessibility

All progress components include proper ARIA attributes:

- `role="progressbar"` for Progress and CircularProgress
- `aria-valuenow`, `aria-valuemin`, `aria-valuemax` for determinate progress
- `aria-busy="true"` for indeterminate states
- `role="status"` for Skeleton

### Performance Tips

1. Use `Skeleton` instead of spinners for content that will be replaced
2. Keep indeterminate progress visible only while loading
3. Use appropriate sizes - don't use large spinners for small UI elements

---

## Migration from Old API

All components maintain backward compatibility with legacy props. However, we recommend using the new simplified API:

### Progress

```tsx
// Old (still works)
<Progress value={75} label="Loading" showPercentage helperText="Please wait" />

// New (recommended)
<div>
  <div className="flex justify-between mb-1">
    <span>Loading</span>
    <span>75%</span>
  </div>
  <Progress value={75} />
  <p className="text-sm text-gray-500 mt-1">Please wait</p>
</div>
```

### Skeleton

```tsx
// Old (still works)
<Skeleton height={100} width={200} isRounded hasShadow />

// New (recommended)
<Skeleton className="h-[100px] w-[200px] rounded-md shadow-sm" />
```

### Stepper

```tsx
// Old (still works - accepts all legacy props)
<Stepper currentStep={2} hasBackground hasShadow>
  <Stepper.Step stepNumber={1} title="Step 1" hasStepLines />
</Stepper>

// New (recommended - simpler)
<Stepper currentStep={2}>
  <Stepper.Step title="Step 1" />
</Stepper>
```
